definitions: grant of money awarded to students to support their education
examples: She received a bursary to cover her university tuition fees
The foundation offers bursaries to disadvantaged students every year

definitions: sudden breaking open or apart with force and noise
short period of intense activity or strong emotion
examples: The water pipe suffered a burst during the freezing weather
They heard a loud burst from the engine compartment
She worked in short bursts throughout the afternoon
There was a sudden burst of applause from the audience

definitions: act of placing something underground, especially a dead body
examples: The burying of the time capsule attracted media attention
Traditional burying ceremonies vary significantly across different cultures

definitions: tall fur hat worn by some British military regiments
examples: The guard's busby added impressive height to his appearance
Each busby is made from Canadian black bear fur

definitions: woody plant smaller than a tree with several stems
wild or uncultivated country, especially in Africa or Australia
examples: She pruned the rose bush in her garden yesterday
The berry bush produces fruit throughout the summer months
They spent weeks camping in the Australian bush
Rangers patrol the bush to protect wildlife from poachers

definitions: unit of capacity equal to eight gallons or thirty-two quarts
examples: The farmer sold apples by the bushel at the market
One bushel of wheat weighs approximately sixty pounds

definitions: member of indigenous peoples of southern Africa, particularly the San
examples: The bushman shared traditional hunting techniques with researchers
Ancient bushman rock art depicts daily life thousands of years ago

definitions: man who works in commerce, especially at executive level
examples: The successful businessman expanded his company internationally last year
Local businessmen gathered to discuss the new development project

definitions: person engaged in commercial or industrial business activities
examples: The businessperson negotiated contracts with several international suppliers
Every businessperson needs strong communication and networking skills

definitions: woman who works in business, especially at executive level
examples: The businesswoman launched her third startup company this year
Leading businesswomen gathered at the annual leadership conference

definitions: person who performs music or entertainment in public places
examples: The talented busker drew large crowds at the subway station
Many famous musicians started their careers as buskers

definitions: sculpture of person's head, shoulders, and chest
woman's breasts or measurement around them
period of economic decline or business failure
examples: The marble bust of Caesar stands in the museum
The artist sculpted a bronze bust of the composer
The dress size includes the bust measurement
She needed a larger bust size for the costume
The company went bust during the economic recession
After the boom came an inevitable bust cycle

definitions: large terrestrial bird found in open country in the Old World
examples: The great bustard is one of the heaviest flying birds
Conservation efforts helped increase bustard populations in protected areas

definitions: informal term used to address a man or boy
person or thing that breaks up or destroys something
examples: Listen here, buster, you need to follow the rules
Watch it, buster, or you'll be in trouble
The new drug is a real cancer buster
This storm is going to be a record buster

definitions: excited activity and movement involving many people
pad or frame worn to puff out a skirt behind
examples: The market square was full of bustle and noise
She enjoyed the bustle of city life after rural living
Victorian women wore a bustle under their dresses
The costume designer added a bustle to the period dress

definitions: colorless gas used as fuel, found in natural gas and petroleum
examples: The camping stove runs on butane gas cartridges
Butane lighters are common household items for lighting candles

definitions: masculine in appearance or manner, typically used of women
examples: She adopted a butch style with short hair and leather jackets
The character's butch persona challenged traditional gender stereotypes

definitions: person whose job is cutting up and selling meat
person who kills brutally or indiscriminately
examples: The local butcher recommended the best cuts for roasting
She ordered lamb chops from the butcher this morning
History remembers him as a butcher of innocent civilians
The press called the general a butcher after the massacre

definitions: process of slaughtering animals and preparing meat for sale
act of killing people or animals in a cruel manner
examples: Traditional butchering requires years of training to master
The butchering process must follow strict hygiene regulations
The butchering of civilians violated international war laws
Witnesses described the brutal butchering of endangered animals

definitions: shop where meat is sold by a butcher
cruel and indiscriminate slaughter of people
examples: The family-owned butchery has operated for three generations
She bought fresh sausages from the local butchery
The battlefield was a scene of complete butchery
Historians documented the butchery that occurred during the invasion

definitions: chief male servant of a household who manages other staff
examples: The butler announced dinner was served in the dining room
In British estates, the butler traditionally manages the wine cellar

definitions: thicker end of something, especially a tool or weapon
person who is the object of ridicule or jokes
remaining part of a smoked cigarette
large cask for storing wine or beer
examples: He gripped the rifle butt firmly against his shoulder
The butt of the axe can be used as a hammer
She became the butt of their cruel jokes
Nobody wants to be the butt of office pranks
The ashtray was full of cigarette butts
Please dispose of your cigarette butt properly
The wine aged in oak butts for several years
Each butt holds approximately 126 gallons of liquid

definitions: isolated flat-topped hill with steep sides, smaller than a mesa
examples: The red sandstone butte dominated the desert landscape
Native Americans considered the butte a sacred landmark

definitions: pale yellow edible fatty substance made from churning cream
examples: She spread butter on her morning toast generously
The recipe calls for unsalted butter at room temperature

definitions: wild plant with bright yellow cup-shaped flowers
examples: Children picked buttercups from the meadow for their mother
The field was covered with buttercups in early summer

definitions: flying insect with large colorful wings and slender body
swimming stroke in which both arms move simultaneously
examples: A monarch butterfly landed on the flowering bush
The butterfly emerged from its chrysalis this morning
She won the gold medal in the butterfly event
Learning the butterfly stroke requires considerable upper body strength

definitions: slightly sour liquid left after butter has been churned
examples: She used buttermilk to make fluffy pancakes this morning
Traditional buttermilk has a tangy flavor and thick consistency

definitions: North American walnut tree producing edible nuts with oily kernels
examples: The butternut harvest was particularly abundant this autumn
Native Americans traditionally used butternut bark for medicine

definitions: small disc sewn on garments for fastening
device pressed to operate a mechanism or electronic system
examples: She sewed a missing button onto her winter coat
The pearl buttons gave the blouse an elegant appearance
Press the red button to start the machine
The elevator button for the tenth floor wasn't working

definitions: act of purchasing something or thing purchased
examples: That car was an excellent buy at half price
The house proved to be the best buy they ever made

definitions: repurchase of shares by a company from its shareholders
examples: The company announced a major stock buyback program yesterday
Share buybacks can increase the value of remaining shares

definitions: person who makes a purchase or acquires goods
examples: The buyer inspected the property before making an offer
Several buyers competed for the rare antique painting

definitions: act or process of acquiring goods or services
examples: Impulse buying can quickly damage your monthly budget
Online buying has revolutionized the retail industry significantly

definitions: purchase of controlling share in a company
examples: The private equity firm completed the buyout last quarter
Management proposed a buyout to take the company private

definitions: low continuous humming or murmuring sound
atmosphere of excitement and activity
examples: The bee's buzz grew louder as it approached
An electrical buzz came from the faulty transformer
There's a real buzz about the new restaurant opening
The buzz around the office concerned upcoming promotions

definitions: large hawk-like bird of prey with broad wings
examples: A buzzard circled high above the open moorland
The common buzzard is widespread across European countryside

definitions: electrical device that makes a buzzing sound as a signal
examples: The quiz show contestant pressed the buzzer quickly
The door buzzer announced another delivery had arrived

definitions: fish or other marine species caught unintentionally while fishing
examples: Commercial fishing nets often contain significant amounts of bycatch
New regulations aim to reduce bycatch of endangered species

definitions: automatic advancement in tournament when no opponent is assigned
informal word used when parting from someone
examples: The top seed received a bye in the first round
Their bye allowed them to rest before the quarterfinals
She waved and called out a cheerful bye
Quick bye, I need to catch my train

definitions: thing or time that belongs to an earlier period
examples: The museum displays artifacts from bygone eras
She collected postcards from bygone days of the city

definitions: rule made by a company or society to control its members
examples: The new bylaw prohibits parking on residential streets overnight
City council passed a bylaw regulating noise levels

definitions: incidental or secondary product made in manufacturing something else
examples: Molasses is a byproduct of sugar refining process
Sawdust is a useful byproduct of lumber production

definitions: person who is present but not taking part in event
examples: Several bystanders witnessed the accident and called for help
An innocent bystander was injured during the confrontation

definitions: unit of computer information equal to eight binary digits
examples: The file size is approximately ten million bytes
Modern computers process billions of bytes per second

definitions: small road or path that is not used frequently
examples: They explored the scenic byways of rural England
The old byway connected two historic villages

definitions: taxi for public hire
driver's compartment in a truck, train, or crane
examples: She hailed a cab outside the airport terminal
The cab driver knew the fastest route downtown
The truck's cab was equipped with modern safety features
He climbed into the cab of the construction crane

definitions: secret political clique or faction plotting against authority
examples: The cabal plotted to overthrow the government leadership
A cabal of investors manipulated the stock prices illegally

definitions: small shelter or hut at a beach or swimming pool
examples: They rented a cabana for shade during their beach day
The resort's poolside cabanas included refreshment service

definitions: nightclub or restaurant with live entertainment and performances
examples: The cabaret featured jazz musicians and dancers every night
They enjoyed dinner and a show at the cabaret

definitions: vegetable with thick green or purple leaves forming a round head
examples: She made coleslaw from fresh cabbage and carrots
The farmer harvested cabbages from the autumn garden
